message.content:
cs.CV, cs.MM, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.GR 

This paper focuses on the problem of colorization for image compression, which involves predicting accurate color from grayscale images to reduce file size. This problem is closely related to computer vision (cs.CV) and machine learning (cs.LG), as the authors propose a deep tree-structured network to generate multiple color hypotheses for every pixel. Additionally, the problem of disambiguating the colorization process due to the multimodal color distribution of objects suggests a connection to multimodal learning (cs.MM). The authors also mention the need to store additional information to reproduce true colors, which could involve information retrieval (cs.IR) techniques. Finally, the paper involves generating visual outputs, which could be related to computer graphics (cs.GR).
